{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3345018,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T04:41:17.619Z","cooked":"

We are experiencing extreme voltage dropping and swerve module jitter while driving. It seems to occur mostly when the robot is commanded at low speeds. When it occurs, the driver station reports voltage fluctuating between 12V and 7-8V, and the Teleop Enabled text flashes Brownout Protection.

While it is not jittering, the driving is also drifting quite a lot both positionally and rotationally. It seems to like to drift to the right side (when commanded to go full forward) and the robot seems to rotate itself clockwise when driving forwards and counterclockwise when driving backwards.

There also appears to be a bigger issue with the back right swerve module, but I will provide more details on that when I confirm them.

Here is a video showcasing the symptoms. It happens pretty frequently, about one in four times we try moving the robot.

Here is our code.

List of things we have tried:

  • Swapping batteries
  • Realigning wheels and resetting CANcoder offsets

It is also worth mentioning that our drive and angle motor PID controllers are not tuned at all and I have just put numbers there that I thought would be a good baseline to start with. I can’t imagine that a poorly tuned PID would cause such voltage drops though.

Our current list of possible explanations:

  • Loose power connection somewhere
  • Faulty swerve module (could be directly related to the supposed back right module issue)

If anyone could point us in the right direction, I am happy to provide more information as well as logging data (if you also tell me how to log from the PDH).

Are you setting power limits on your motors? What is your idle battery voltage on the DS?

N0tACyb0rg:

Are you setting power limits on your motors?

If by power limit you mean the current limit, yes we are setting those using

motor.setSmartCurrentLimit()

on the CANSparkMax. The angle motor current limit is 25 and the drive motor current limit is 45. I have also edited the original post to link our code. The current limits are defined in the Constants file and lib/drivers/swerve/SwerveCANSparkMax.java configures the motor.

N0tACyb0rg:

What is your idle battery voltage on the DS?

Our idle battery voltage shown on the driver station is about 12.3-12.5V

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T05:07:45.125Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":42.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/3","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345034,"name":"Caleb Marshall","username":"N0tACyb0rg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/n0tacyb0rg/{size}/218596_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T05:12:56.778Z","cooked":"
myer:

the drive motor current limit is 45.

What breakers are you using? If you’re using 40A, that current limit should be set to like 30-40.

Try bringing the drive motor limit down to around 30 for now, as what is happening looks like a brownout, not something being loose (and, for good measure, check your batteries).

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T05:13:15.936Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Caleb Marshall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5683 Programming Co-Lead"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/4","custom_user_title":"5683 Programming Co-Lead","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345035,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T05:16:45.002Z","cooked":"
N0tACyb0rg:

Try bringing the drive motor limit down to around 30 for now

Will do this in the lab tomorrow and update.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T05:16:45.002Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/5","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345645,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T20:11:45.514Z","cooked":"

We discovered this:

Screenshot_2024-03-27-15-51-51-11_92460851df6f172a4592fca41cc2d2e61116×2484 117 KB

on our back right swerve angle motor. This confirms our suspicions about the back right module having problems.

About the current limit thing, I have confirmed that our breakers on the swerve module motors are 40A, so I have lowered the current limit to 30 in code for now, but I am waiting on the mechanical team to mount the new motor.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T20:11:45.514Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":31.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/6/9672e7ca88b6f9b599d43d75dca9a0c7c8b93cb0.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64553,"username":"myer","name":"Myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/6","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345674,"name":"Michael Havrylyuk","username":"MongooseTNM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mongoosetnm/{size}/176243_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T20:53:53.251Z","cooked":"

we run our drive motors at 60A with no problems (not recommended, the voltage drops to like 9v sometimes, no brownouts tho). So there is a high chance that your batteries are just bad and you need new ones.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T20:54:04.376Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":26.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Michael Havrylyuk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64553,"username":"myer","name":"Myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54361,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/7","custom_user_title":"2811 Alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345676,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T20:58:47.672Z","cooked":"
MongooseTNM:

no brownouts tho

I’m assuming you have 60A breakers on your PDH for those motors then. We were potentially trying to run at higher current than our breakers could handle.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T20:58:47.672Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/8","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345688,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T21:09:56.779Z","cooked":"

No, the REV 40A breakers can run at higher current levels for a while before triggering. 60A is a common value to set for your drive motors.

That 100 percent seems to be a brownout, which is interesting since you have current limits. What are your steer motors set to? Could also be a bad battery.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T21:09:56.779Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64553,"username":"myer","name":"Myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/9","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345690,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T21:12:42.714Z","cooked":"

i’m remembering my team having a very similar issue but we fixed ours with getting a fully charged battery so i don’t know how to fix it other than that

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T21:12:42.714Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":17.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/10","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345913,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T01:46:39.683Z","cooked":"
bcon:

That 100 percent seems to be a brownout, which is interesting since you have current limits.

Well, I’m thinking that those burnt/grinded motor wires I showed in a previous reply has something to do with it. We tested our swerve today after replacing that motor and there were no more brownout issues, but I have also lowered the current limit quite a lot. We noticed a problem with the back right drive motor (same module that motor with a burnt wire was in), so tomorrow we plan on replacing that motor and trying the drive again. If it works fine, I will slowly increase the current limit back to a reasonable value (it used to be at 45).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-28T01:46:39.683Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/11","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345917,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T01:54:37.921Z","cooked":"

This is not the case. The rev 40 A breakers can handle far more than 40 amps for short periods, and slight above 40 amps for very long periods (on the order of minutes).

Look up the breaker curve.

We run our current at 80 per for .25 seconds then drop it to 55.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-28T01:55:19.695Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460309,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57197,"username":"N0tACyb0rg","name":"Caleb Marshall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/n0tacyb0rg/{size}/218596_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-extreme-jitter-voltage-drop/460309/12","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345931,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T02:10:09.083Z","cooked":"

Burnt wire would also do the same, especially if you are effectivly shorting your robot to its frame. (Hence, brownout)

Glad to hear it seems to be working
